option.name: device+optional revision of target silicon (--silicon_version, -v)
option.tip: Aliases: --silicon_version, -v<BODY>Specify the device (and optionally the revision) of the target silicon device to generate code optimized for the revision and to work around issues raised by Silicon Advisories for the revision. Can be specified multiple times to support multiple silicon versions. An argument of 'list' will display the list of recognized arguments

option.name: Debugging model
option.tip:
(-g) - Enable full symbolic DWARF debugging in the generated object or out file. (--symdebug:coff) - Enable full symbolic COFF debugging in the generated object or out file (DEPRECATED). (--symdebug:profile_coff) - Adds the necessary debug directives to the object file which are needed by the profiler to allow function level profiling with minimal impact on optimization (if optimization is enabled). Using -g may hinder some optimizations to ensure that debuggability is maintained, while this option will not hinder optimization.
You will still be able to set breakpoints and profile on function-level boundaries, but you will not be able to single-step through code as with full debug ability. (--symdebug:none) - Disable debug and suppress all symbolic debug information from being included in the generated object or out file. (--symdebug:skeletal) - Enable symbolic debug information for program analysis. (default)

option.name: Optimization level (--opt_level, -O)
option.tip:
Aliases: --opt_level, -O<BODY>Set compiler optimization level.
Level 0 includes register optimizations. Level 1 adds local optimizations. Level 2 further adds global optimizations. Level 3 further adds interprocedure optimizations.
Using -O without arguments defaults to -O2.

option.name: C/C++ Dialect
option.tip: (--embedded_cpp) - Enable support for embedded C++ (--kr_compatible) - Enable K & R C compatibility.

option.name: Language mode
option.tip: (--relaxed_ansi) - Enable relaxed ANSI source parsing mode. (--strict_ansi) - Enable strict ANSI source parsing mode. Any source violating strict ANSI guidelines will generate a parsing error.

option.name: Disable intrinsic functions (--no_intrinsics, -pn)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_intrinsics, -pn<BODY>Disable intrinsic functions in the parser.

option.name: Output xref listing to .crl file (--gen_acp_xref, -px)
option.tip: Aliases: --gen_acp_xref, -px<BODY>Output xref listing to .crl file

option.name: Do not delete unreferenced static variables (--keep_unneeded_statics)
option.tip: Aliases: --keep_unneeded_statics<BODY>The parser, by default, will remark about and then remove any unreferenced static variables. This option will keep the parser from deleting unreferenced static variables and any static functions that are, in turn referenced by these variables.

option.name: Ignore inline keyword (--no_inlining, -pi)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_inlining, -pi<BODY>Ignore the inline keyword while parsing.

option.name: Program mode compilation (--program_level_compile, -pm)
option.tip: Aliases: --program_level_compile, -pm<BODY>Enable program mode compilation.

option.name: Output raw listing to .rl file (--gen_acp_raw, -pl)
option.tip: Aliases: --gen_acp_raw, -pl<BODY>Output raw listing to .rl file

option.name: Multibyte character support (--multibyte_chars, -pc)
option.tip: Aliases: --multibyte_chars, -pc<BODY>Enable multibyte character support in the parser.

option.name: Enable C++ exception handling (--exceptions)
option.tip: Aliases: --exceptions<BODY>Enable C++ exception handling

option.name: Support C++ run-time type information (--rtti, -rtti)
option.tip: Aliases: --rtti, -rtti<BODY>Support C++ run-time type information

option.name: Treat C files as C++ files (--cpp_default, -fg)
option.tip: Aliases: --cpp_default, -fg<BODY>Treat C files as C++ files

option.name: Enable support for GCC extensions (--gcc)
option.tip: Aliases: --gcc<BODY>This option enables the support for GCC extensions

option.name: Do static early template instantiation (--static_template_instantiation)
option.tip: Aliases: --static_template_instantiation<BODY>All template entities are instantiated as needed in the file. The instantiations are given internal (static) linkage.

option.name: Mode
option.tip: In 'automatic' mode, CCS will implicitly use the parser-preprocessing options to generate source dependency-graph. In 'manual' mode, no dependency-graph is generated, and the user has full manual control over the preprocessing options.

option.name: Generate list of pre- & user-defined macros (--preproc_macros, -ppm)
option.tip: Aliases: --preproc_macros, -ppm<BODY>Generate a list of predefined and user defined macros for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include only those files directly included by the source file. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the macro list (similar to gcc).

option.name: Preprocess only; maintain comments (--preproc_with_comment, -ppc)
option.tip: Aliases: --preproc_with_comment, -ppc<BODY>Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop; maintain source comments in the output.

option.name: Generate first-level include file list (--preproc_includes, -ppi)
option.tip: Aliases: --preproc_includes, -ppi<BODY>Generate an include list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include only those files directly included by the source file. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the include list (similar to gcc).

option.name: Preprocess only (--preproc_only, -ppo)
option.tip: Aliases: --preproc_only, -ppo<BODY>Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop.

option.name: Continue compilation after using -pp<X> options. (--preproc_with_compile, -ppa)
option.tip: Aliases: --preproc_with_compile, -ppa<BODY>This option instructs the compiler to additionally continue compilation of the source file (rather than exiting) after generating a pre-processing .pp output file such as those generated by -ppd (dependencies) -ppi (included files), or -ppm (macros).

option.name: Preprocess only; maintain line directives (--preproc_with_line, -ppl)
option.tip: Aliases: --preproc_with_line, -ppl<BODY>Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop; maintain #line directives in the output..

option.name: Generate include file dependency information (--preproc_dependency, -ppd)
option.tip: Aliases: --preproc_dependency, -ppd<BODY>Generate a dependency list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include all files included in the source file as well as any of the files included. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the dependency list (similar to gcc).

option.name: Pre-define NAME (--define, -D)
option.tip: Aliases: --define, -D<BODY>Pre-define a symbol with the id 'NAME', optionally setting it's contents to 'value'.

option.name: Undefine NAME (--undefine, -U)
option.tip: Aliases: --undefine, -U<BODY>Undefine the symbol with the id 'NAME'.

option.name: Add dir to #include search path (--include_path, -I)
option.tip: Aliases: --include_path, -I<BODY>Add the specified dir(ectory) to the #include file search path list.

option.name: Specify a preinclude file (--preinclude)
option.tip: Aliases: --preinclude<BODY>Include the source code of the indicated file at the beginning of the compilation. This can be used to establish standard macro definitions, etc. The file name is searched for in the directories on the include search list. The files are processed in the order in which they were specified.

option.name: Quiet Level
option.tip: (--verbose) - Display progress information and toolset version when executing. (--quiet) - Suppress common compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated, as well as feature specific status. (--super_quiet) - Suppress all compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated.

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Display banner and function progress information (--verbose)

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as remark (--diag_remark, -pdsr)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_remark, -pdsr<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as remark

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as error (--diag_error, -pdse)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_error, -pdse<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as error

option.name: Emit diagnostic identifier numbers (--display_error_number, -pden)
option.tip: Aliases: --display_error_number, -pden<BODY>Emit the diagnostic identifier numbers along with diagnostic messages. These identifiers can be used with options such as -pds to suppress a specific diagnostic.

option.name: Suppress diagnostic <id> (--diag_suppress, -pds)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_suppress, -pds<BODY>Suppress diagnostic <id>

option.name: Issue remarks (--issue_remarks, -pdr)
option.tip: Aliases: --issue_remarks, -pdr<BODY>Issue remarks, which are normally supressed.

option.name: Verbose diagnostics (--verbose_diagnostics, -pdv)
option.tip: Aliases: --verbose_diagnostics, -pdv<BODY>Enable verbose diagnostic information from the parser, including the source line of the error and an indicator of the error position within the line.

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as warning (--diag_warning, -pdsw)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_warning, -pdsw<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as warning

option.name: Set error limit to <count> (--set_error_limit, -pdel)
option.tip: Aliases: --set_error_limit, -pdel<BODY>Set error limit to <count>

option.name: Generate user information file (--gen_aux_user_info, -b)
option.tip: Aliases: --gen_aux_user_info, -b<BODY>Generate auxillary user information file.

option.name: Output diagnostic to .err file (--write_diagnostics_file, -pdf)
option.tip: Aliases: --write_diagnostics_file, -pdf<BODY>Write diagnostics to an .err file instead of the standard output. The file name with be the same as the source file but with an .err extension.

option.name: Suppress warnings (--no_warnings, -pdw)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_warnings, -pdw<BODY>Suppress all parser warnings.

option.name: Print version numbers for each tool (--tool_version, -version)
option.tip: Aliases: --tool_version, -version<BODY>Print version numbers for each tool

option.name: Activate byte mode (CHAR_BIT==8) (--byte_mode)
option.tip: Aliases: --byte_mode<BODY>Activate byte mode (CHAR_BIT==8)

option.name: Optimize fully in the presence of debug directives (--optimize_with_debug, -mn)
option.tip: Aliases: --optimize_with_debug, -mn<BODY>Optimize fully in the presence of debug directives

option.name: Align functions to reduce fetch stalls (--align_functions)
option.tip: Aliases: --align_functions<BODY>Align functions to reduce fetch stalls

option.name: Allow reassociation of sat arithmetic (--sat_reassoc)
option.tip: Aliases: --sat_reassoc<BODY>Set to on to allow reassociation of saturating arithmetic even in cases where the reassociation will cause saturation to occur differently.

option.name: Assert ARMS status bit initially set (--assert_arms_set, -ata)
option.tip: Aliases: --assert_arms_set, -ata<BODY>Assert ARMS status bit initially set

option.name: Use large memory model (--large_memory_model, -ml)
option.tip: Aliases: --large_memory_model, -ml<BODY>Use large memory model

option.name: Specify type size to hold results of pointer math (--ptrdiff_size)
option.tip: Aliases: --ptrdiff_size<BODY>Specify type size to hold results of pointer math

option.name: Remove NOP in delay slots (--no_nops_in_delay, -atn)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_nops_in_delay, -atn<BODY>Remove NOP in delay slots

option.name: Assert C54CM status bit is set (--assert_c54cm_set, -atl)
option.tip: Aliases: --assert_c54cm_set, -atl<BODY>Assert C54CM status bit is set

option.name: Allow reassociation of FP arithmetic (--fp_reassoc)
option.tip: Aliases: --fp_reassoc<BODY>Set to on to allow reassociation of floating point arithmetic even in cases where the reassociation will result in a slightly different answer.

option.name: Place each function in a separate subsection (--gen_func_subsections, -mo)
option.tip: Aliases: --gen_func_subsections, -mo<BODY>Place each function in a separate subsection

option.name: Codegen outputs algebraic assembly (--algebraic, -mg)
option.tip: Aliases: --algebraic, -mg<BODY>Codegen outputs algebraic assembly

option.name: Assume no irregular alias or loop behavior (--no_bad_aliases, -mt)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_bad_aliases, -mt<BODY>Assume no irregular alias or loop behavior

option.name: Enums may be char/short, instead of int (--small_enum, --small-enum)
option.tip: Aliases: --small_enum, --small-enum<BODY>Enums may be char/short, instead of int

option.name: Don't expand assembly macros when outputting source (--no_mac_expand, --nomacx)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_mac_expand, --nomacx<BODY>Don't expand assembly macros when outputting source

option.name: No block/local repeats (--no_block_repeat, -mr)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_block_repeat, -mr<BODY>No block/local repeats

option.name: Changes bus conflict errors to warnings (--bus_conflict, -atb)
option.tip: Aliases: --bus_conflict, -atb<BODY>Changes bus conflict errors to warnings

option.name: Specify memory model (small/large/huge) (--memory_model)
option.tip: Aliases: --memory_model<BODY>Specify memory model (small/large/huge)

option.name: Select assembly source language (--asm_source)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_source<BODY>Used by shell to explicitly select assembly source language

option.name: Assert CPL status bit initially set (--assert_cpl_set, -atc)
option.tip: Aliases: --assert_cpl_set, -atc<BODY>Assert CPL status bit initially set

option.name: Compile for power profiling (--profile:power)
option.tip: Aliases: --profile:power<BODY>Enable power profiling support by inserting NOPs into the frame code. These NOPs can then be instrumented by the power profiling tooling to track power usage of functions. If the power profiling tool is not used, this option will increase the cycle count of each function because of the NOPs. This switch also disables optimizations that cannot be handled by the power-profiler.

option.name: Assert SST status bit is zero (--assert_sst_zero, -att)
option.tip: Aliases: --assert_sst_zero, -att<BODY>Assert SST status bit is zero

option.name: All gotos/calls are encoded as 24-bit offset (--use_long_branch, -atv)
option.tip: Aliases: --use_long_branch, -atv<BODY>All gotos/calls are encoded as 24-bit offset

option.name: Assume all BSS is on-chip (--assume_bss_onchip, -mb)
option.tip: Aliases: --assume_bss_onchip, -mb<BODY>Assume all BSS is on-chip

option.name: ROM allocatable constants (--const_in_cinit, -mc)
option.tip: Aliases: --const_in_cinit, -mc<BODY>ROM allocatable constants

option.name: Do not generate low_byte/high_byte operands (--no_byte_operands)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_byte_operands<BODY>Do not generate low_byte/high_byte operands

option.name: Port for speed over size (--port_for_speed, -ath)
option.tip: Aliases: --port_for_speed, -ath<BODY>Port for speed over size

option.name: Allow C54x native mnemonic assembly source (--translate_c54x_mnem_source)
option.tip: Aliases: --translate_c54x_mnem_source<BODY>Allow C54x native mnemonic assembly source

option.name: Max length of instruction sequence to predicate (--predication_level)
option.tip: Aliases: --predication_level<BODY>Max length of instruction sequence to predicate

option.name: Generate optimized source interlisted assembly (--optimizer_interlist, -os)
option.tip: Aliases: --optimizer_interlist, -os<BODY>Generate optimized source interlisted assembly

option.name: Remove entry/exit hooks from inlined functions (--remove_hooks_when_inlining)
option.tip: Aliases: --remove_hooks_when_inlining<BODY>Remove the entry and exit hooks from the bodies of inlined functions.

option.name: Optimize for speed (--opt_for_speed, -mf)
option.tip: Aliases: --opt_for_speed, -mf<BODY>Optimize for speed

option.name: Generate optimizer information file at level [0-2] (--gen_opt_info, -on)
option.tip: Aliases: --gen_opt_info, -on<BODY>Set the optimizer information file level, or disable with 0. Level 1 includes basic information. Level 2 includes detailed information. The file will be created in the assembly directory if a custom asm directory is specified on the command line otherwise it will be created in the object file directory.

option.name: Specify call assumptions when optimizing (--call_assumptions, -op)
option.tip:
Aliases: --call_assumptions, -op<BODY>Specify assumptions to make about function calls when optimizing.
Level 0 (-op0) indicates that the module has functions that are called from other modules.
Level 1 (-op1) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called by other modules but has global variables that are modified in other modules.
Level 2 (-op2) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called or globals that are modified by other modules.
Level 3 (-op3) indicates that the module has functions that are called by other modules but does not have globals that are modified by other modules.

option.name: Specify threshold for automatic inlining (--auto_inline, -oi)
option.tip: Aliases: --auto_inline, -oi<BODY>Specify threshold for automatic inlining

option.name: Inline functions only called once. (--single_inline)
option.tip: Aliases: --single_inline<BODY>Inline function that are called only once. Will inline these functions even if auto inlining has been turned off (-oi0)

option.name: Optimize for code size (--opt_for_space, -ms)
option.tip: Aliases: --opt_for_space, -ms<BODY>Optimize for code size

option.name: Assume called funcs create hidden aliases (rare) (--aliased_variables, -ma)
option.tip: Aliases: --aliased_variables, -ma<BODY>Assume called funcs create hidden aliases (rare)

option.name: Pass caller's name or address to entry hook (--entry_parm)
option.tip: Aliases: --entry_parm<BODY>Pass caller's name or address to entry hook

option.name: Insert this call at exit from each function (--exit_hook)
option.tip: Aliases: --exit_hook<BODY>Insert this call at exit from each function

option.name: Pass caller's name or address to exit hook (--exit_parm)
option.tip: Aliases: --exit_parm<BODY>Pass caller's name or address to exit hook

option.name: Insert this call at entry to each function (--entry_hook)
option.tip: Aliases: --entry_hook<BODY>Insert this call at entry to each function

option.name: Generate analysis info from profile data (--analyze)
option.tip: Aliases: --analyze<BODY>Generate analysis information about code coverage or call graph information in the form of CSV files. This information can then be read and interpreted by other tools. For example, the cache layout tool, clt6x, can be used to interpret the call graph information and produce a preferred function order that can be incorporated into the application link. The compiler can only generate one kind of analysis information for a given invocation of the compiler.

option.name: Generate profile feedback data (--gen_profile_info)
option.tip: Aliases: --gen_profile_info<BODY>Instrument the object code that is generated for a compilation with path profiling information. The compiler will annotate the code that is generated for an application so that, when executed, the application can generate information about which code paths were executed and how often. This profile data can then be used by subsequent compiles to analyze code coverage or call graph information to assist with subsequent development.

option.name: Use profile feedback file(s) (--use_profile_info)
option.tip: Aliases: --use_profile_info<BODY>This option is used in combination with the --analyze option to generate analysis information about code coverage or call graph information in the form of CSV files. This information can then be read and interpreted by other tools. For example, the cache layout tool, clt6x, can be used to interpret the call graph information and produce a preferred function order that can be incorporated into the application link. The compiler can only generate one kind of analysis information for a given invocation of the compiler.

option.name: Only generate analysis (--analyze_only)
option.tip: Aliases: --analyze_only<BODY>Generate analysis only; do not continue compilation. This option is used in combination with the --analyze option to instruct the compiler to halt the compilation after it has completed the generation of analysis information requested in the --analyze option.

option.name: Level of printf support required (--printf_support)
option.tip:
Aliases: --printf_support<BODY>Printf/sprintf functions use a common low level routine, _printfi which processes a given printf format string. The full version of _printfi provides formatting capabalities that are not required in typical embedded applications. To address this the C runtime library also includes two limited of versions of _printfi that provide a useful subset of the formatting features specified by C library standard.
One version excludes support for printing floating values. All format specifiers except for %f, %g, %G, %e, or %E are supported. To specify this version use the option '--printf_support=nofloat' when linking.
The other version only supports printing of integer, char, or string values without width or precision flags. Only %%, %d, %o, %c, %s and %x are supported. To specify this version use the option '--printf_support=minimal' when linking.

option.name: File contains an RTS library function. (--std_lib_func_defined, -ol1)
option.tip: Aliases: --std_lib_func_defined, -ol1<BODY>File contains an RTS library function.

option.name: File does not define any RTS library func (def.) (--std_lib_func_not_defined, -ol2)
option.tip: Aliases: --std_lib_func_not_defined, -ol2<BODY>File does not define any RTS library func (def.)

option.name: File redefines an RTS library function. (--std_lib_func_redefined, -ol0)
option.tip: Aliases: --std_lib_func_redefined, -ol0<BODY>File redefines an RTS library function.

option.name: Keep the generated assembly language (.asm) file (--keep_asm, -k)
option.tip: Aliases: --keep_asm, -k<BODY>Keep the generated assembly language (.asm) file

option.name: Source interlist
option.tip: (--src_interlist) - Generate interlisted assembly file (--c_src_interlist) - Generate C source interlisted assembly file

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Generate C source interlisted assembly file (--c_src_interlist, -ss)

option.name: Generate listing file (--asm_listing, -al)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_listing, -al<BODY>Generate listing file

option.name: Keep local symbols in output file (--output_all_syms, -as)
option.tip: Aliases: --output_all_syms, -as<BODY>Keep local symbols in output file

option.name: Do not generate .clink for .const sections (--no_const_clink)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_const_clink<BODY>Do not generate .clink directives for const global arrays. By default these arrays are placed in a .const subsection and conditionally linked.

option.name: Simulate source '.copy filename' (--copy_file, -ahc)
option.tip: Aliases: --copy_file, -ahc<BODY>Simulate source '.copy filename'

option.name: Symbol names are not case-significant (--syms_ignore_case, -ac)
option.tip: Aliases: --syms_ignore_case, -ac<BODY>Symbol names are not case-significant

option.name: Undefine assembly symbol NAME (--asm_undefine, -au)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_undefine, -au<BODY>Undefine assembly symbol NAME

option.name: Do not require '#' on shift counts (mnem only) (--hash_optional_shift_count, -ats)
option.tip: Aliases: --hash_optional_shift_count, -ats<BODY>Do not require '#' on shift counts (mnem only)

option.name: Pre-define assembly symbol NAME (--asm_define, -ad)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_define, -ad<BODY>Pre-define the assembly symbol NAME, optionally setting its contents to 'value'.

option.name: Suppress all assembler warnings (--suppress_asm_warnings, -atw)
option.tip: Aliases: --suppress_asm_warnings, -atw<BODY>Suppress all assembler warnings

option.name: Generate first-level assembly include file list (--asm_includes, -api)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_includes, -api<BODY>Generate first-level assembly include file list

option.name: Generate assembly dependency information (--asm_dependency, -apd)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_dependency, -apd<BODY>Generate assembly dependency information

option.name: Suppress identified assembler remark (--suppress_remark, -ar)
option.tip: Aliases: --suppress_remark, -ar<BODY>Suppress identified assembler remark

option.name: Simulate source '.include filename' (--include_file, -ahi)
option.tip: Aliases: --include_file, -ahi<BODY>Simulate source '.include filename'

option.name: Generate cross reference file (--cross_reference, -ax)
option.tip: Aliases: --cross_reference, -ax<BODY>Generate cross reference file

option.name: File is an object file (default for .obj) (--obj_file, -fo)
option.tip: Aliases: --obj_file, -fo<BODY>File is an object file (default for .obj)

option.name: File is a C++ file (default for .C .cpp .cc) (--cpp_file, -fp)
option.tip: Aliases: --cpp_file, -fp<BODY>File is a C++ file (default for .C .cpp .cc)

option.name: File is a C file (default for .c/no ext) (--c_file, -fc)
option.tip: Aliases: --c_file, -fc<BODY>File is a C file (default for .c/no ext)

option.name: File is an assembly file (default for .asm) (--asm_file, -fa)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_file, -fa<BODY>File is an assembly file (default for .asm)

option.name: Mode
option.tip: In 'automatic' mode, CCS will implicitly control intermediate-file directories to reflect the source-file directory structure. In 'manual' mode, the user has full manual control over the intermediate-file directories.

option.name: Temporary file directory (default is .) (--temp_directory, -ft)
option.tip: Aliases: --temp_directory, -ft<BODY>Temporary file directory (default is .)

option.name: Object file directory (default is .) (--obj_directory, -fr)
option.tip: Aliases: --obj_directory, -fr<BODY>Object file directory (default is .)

option.name: Assembly file directory (default is .) (--asm_directory, -fs)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_directory, -fs<BODY>Assembly file directory (default is .)

option.name: Listing/xref file directory (default is .obj dir) (--list_directory, -ff)
option.tip: Aliases: --list_directory, -ff<BODY>Listing/xref file directory (default is .obj dir)

option.name: Preprocessor file directory (default is .)
option.tip: Place preprocessor output files in specified directory.

option.name: Extension for C++ files (default is .cpp) (--cpp_extension, -ep)
option.tip: Aliases: --cpp_extension, -ep<BODY>Extension for C++ files (default is .cpp)

option.name: Extension for C files (default is .c) (--c_extension, -ec)
option.tip: Aliases: --c_extension, -ec<BODY>Extension for C files (default is .c)

option.name: Extension for object files (default is .obj) (--obj_extension, -eo)
option.tip: Aliases: --obj_extension, -eo<BODY>Extension for object files (default is .obj)

option.name: Extension for listing files (default is .lst) (--listing_extension, -es)
option.tip: Aliases: --listing_extension, -es<BODY>Extension for listing files (default is .lst)

option.name: Extension for assembly files (default is .asm) (--asm_extension, -ea)
option.tip: Aliases: --asm_extension, -ea<BODY>Extension for assembly files (default is .asm)

option.name: Read options from specified file (--cmd_file, -@)
option.tip: Aliases: --cmd_file, -@<BODY>Read additional compile options the specified filename.

option.name: Specify output file name (--output_file, -o)
option.tip: Aliases: --output_file, -o<BODY>Full filename of the output file.

option.name: Input and output sections listed into <file> (--map_file, -m)
option.tip: Aliases: --map_file, -m<BODY>Produce a listing of all input and output sections into <file>.

option.name: Set C system stack size (--stack_size, -stack)
option.tip: Aliases: --stack_size, -stack<BODY>Set C system stack size

option.name: Heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation (--heap_size, -heap)
option.tip: Aliases: --heap_size, -heap<BODY>Specify the maximum heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation.

option.name: Pre-define preprocessor macro _name_ to _value_ (--define)
option.tip: Aliases: --define<BODY>Pre-define preprocessor macro _name_ to _value_

option.name: Undefine preprocessor macro _name_ (--undefine)
option.tip: Aliases: --undefine<BODY>Undefine preprocessor macro _name_

option.name: Don't use C preprocessor for command files (--disable_pp)
option.tip: Aliases: --disable_pp<BODY>This disables preprocessing of linker command files.

option.name: Verbose diagnostics (--verbose_diagnostics)
option.tip: Aliases: --verbose_diagnostics<BODY>Verbose diagnostics

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as warning (--diag_warning)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_warning<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as warning

option.name: Emit diagnostic identifier numbers (--display_error_number)
option.tip: Aliases: --display_error_number<BODY>Emit diagnostic identifier numbers

option.name: Suppress warnings (--no_warnings)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_warnings<BODY>Suppress warnings

option.name: Set error limit to <count> (--set_error_limit)
option.tip: Aliases: --set_error_limit<BODY>Set error limit to <count>

option.name: Suppress diagnostic <id> (--diag_suppress)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_suppress<BODY>Suppress diagnostic <id>

option.name: Issue remarks (--issue_remarks)
option.tip: Aliases: --issue_remarks<BODY>Issue remarks

option.name: Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics (--no_demangle)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_demangle<BODY>Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as remark (--diag_remark)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_remark<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as remark

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as error (--diag_error)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_error<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as error

option.name: Warn if an unspecified output section is created (--warn_sections, -w)
option.tip: Aliases: --warn_sections, -w<BODY>Warn if an unspecified output section is created

option.name: Include library file or command file as input (--library, -l)
option.tip: Aliases: --library, -l<BODY>Include library file or command file as input

option.name: Add <dir> to library search path (--search_path, -i)
option.tip: Aliases: --search_path, -i<BODY>Alter the library-search algorithm to look in dir before looking in the default location. This option must appear before the -l option.

option.name: Search libraries in priority order (--priority, -priority)
option.tip: Aliases: --priority, -priority<BODY>Search libraries in priority order

option.name: Disable automatic RTS selection (--disable_auto_rts)
option.tip: Aliases: --disable_auto_rts<BODY>Disable automatic RTS selection

option.name: Reread libraries; resolve backward references (--reread_libs, -x)
option.tip: Aliases: --reread_libs, -x<BODY>Reread libraries; resolve backward references

option.name: Detailed link information data-base into <file> (--xml_link_info, -xml_link_info)
option.tip: Aliases: --xml_link_info, -xml_link_info<BODY>Produce a detailed link information data-base into the file named <file>.

option.name: List removed dead functions into file (--generate_dead_funcs_list)
option.tip: Aliases: --generate_dead_funcs_list<BODY>Create a list, into the file <fname>, of the routines and sections that are dead (never referenced) and were removed by the linker. The default <fname> is 'dead_funcs.txt'.

option.name: Produce a relocatable output module (--relocatable, -r)
option.tip: Aliases: --relocatable, -r<BODY>Produce a relocatable output module

option.name: Produce absolute executable object file (default) (--absolute_exe, -a)
option.tip: Aliases: --absolute_exe, -a<BODY>Produce absolute executable object file (default)

option.name: Display attribute settings in map file (--mapfile_contents)
option.tip: Aliases: --mapfile_contents<BODY>Enable the display of <attribute> or disable with no<attribute> in the linker generated map file. Multiple attributes can be specified by separating them with commas (e.g. --mapfile_contents=sections,nosymbols). Type --mapfile_contents=help for a list of attributes.

option.name: Make all global symbols static (--make_static, -h)
option.tip: Aliases: --make_static, -h<BODY>Make all global symbols static

option.name: Specify program entry point for the output module (--entry_point, -e)
option.tip: Aliases: --entry_point, -e<BODY>Specify program entry point for the output module

option.name: Specify a symbol map, mapping refname to defname (--symbol_map)
option.tip: Aliases: --symbol_map<BODY>Symbol mapping allows a symbol reference to be resolved by a symbol with different name. Symbol mapping allows functions to be overridden with alternate definitions. This feature can be used to patch in alternate implementations, which provide patches (bug fixes) or alternate functionality. For example, the option --symbol_map='foo=foo_patch' makes the linker resolve any references to foo by the definition foo_patch.

option.name: Strip symbol table and line number entries (--no_symtable, -s)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_symtable, -s<BODY>Strip symbol table and line number entries

option.name: Do not localize symbols matching pattern (--globalize)
option.tip: Aliases: --globalize<BODY>The option '--localize=l_pattern' makes the symbols matching the l_pattern hidden. The '--globalilze=g_pattern' option excludes symbols matching g_pattern from symbol localization provided g_pattern is more restrictive than l_pattern.

option.name: Scan libraries for duplicate symbol definitions (--scan_libraries, -scanlibs)
option.tip: Aliases: --scan_libraries, -scanlibs<BODY>Check whether symbol definitions that are pulled into the link are duplicated in any of the libraries included in the build. This information is typically ignored as the linker will pull in the first definition it encounters.

option.name: Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol (--undef_sym, -u)
option.tip: Aliases: --undef_sym, -u<BODY>Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol

option.name: Exclude symbols matching pattern from hinding (--unhide)
option.tip: Aliases: --unhide<BODY>The option --hide=hide_pattern makes the symbols matching the hide_pattern hidden. The --unhide=unhide_pattern option excludes symbols matching unhide_pattern from symbol hiding provided unhide_pattern is more restrictive than hide_pattern.

option.name: Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified (--make_global, -g)
option.tip: Aliases: --make_global, -g<BODY>Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified

option.name: Hide symbols matching pattern (--hide)
option.tip: Aliases: --hide<BODY>Hide the symbols matching the pattern by changing the name to empty string

option.name: No type merging in symbolic debugging information (--no_sym_merge, -b)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_sym_merge, -b<BODY>Disable type merging in symbolic debugging information.

option.name: Make the symbols matching pattern local (--localize)
option.tip: Aliases: --localize<BODY>Given a symbol name pattern, make all the symbols matching this pattern local

option.name: Initialization model
option.tip: (--rom_model) - Link using ROM autoinitialization model (--ram_model) - Link using RAM autoinitialization model

option.name: Set C argc/argv memory size (--arg_size, --args)
option.tip: Aliases: --arg_size, --args<BODY>Set C argc/argv memory size

option.name: Specify size of output sysstack section (--sys_stacksize, -sysstack)
option.tip: Aliases: --sys_stacksize, -sysstack<BODY>Specify size of output sysstack section

option.name: Default fill value for holes in output sections (--fill_value, -f)
option.tip: Aliases: --fill_value, -f<BODY>Set the default full value for fulling holes in output sections.

option.name: Allow word mode code in byte mode executable (--byte_with_word_mode)
option.tip: Aliases: --byte_with_word_mode<BODY>Allow word mode code in byte mode executable

option.name: Add <function> to preferred placement order list (--preferred_order)
option.tip: Aliases: --preferred_order<BODY>Insert a function into the preferred function order list for placement. Functions that are close to each other in the preferred function order list will tend to be placed close together (increase program locality between them). Static functions of the same name can be distinguished from each other by prefixing the function name with the path and file in which the function is defined followed by a ':' character to delimit the beginning of the function name.

option.name: Disable conditional linking & ignore .clink (--disable_clink, -j)
option.tip: Aliases: --disable_clink, -j<BODY>Disable conditional linking; ignore all .clink directives.

option.name: Strict compatibility checking (--strict_compatibility)
option.tip: Aliases: --strict_compatibility<BODY>Strict compatibility checking

option.name: The DSBT index of this component (--dsbt_index)
option.tip: Aliases: --dsbt_index<BODY>The Data Segment Base Table (DSBT) contains the Data Page (DP) pointer for each component (executable or shared object) in a dynamic linking system. A dynamic component uses a unique index to access its DP value. This index can be allocated at run time by the dynamic loader or can be statically assigned via this option. The index value should be less than the DSBT size.

option.name: The size of Data Segment Base Table (DSBT) in words (--dsbt_size)
option.tip: Aliases: --dsbt_size<BODY>The Data Segment Base Table (DSBT) contains the Data Page (DP) pointer for each component (executable or shared object) in a dynamic linking system. Each dynamic component in the system has an entry in the DSBT. This option specifies the size of the DSBT, and should be no less than the number of dynamic components in the system.

option.name: Quiet mode - normal status messages suppressed (q)
